DataElement.preferredName: Serological Hematology Hepatitis B Surface Antigen Test Collection Status Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the serological hematology test, the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens, for the hepatitis B surface antigen, any one of the hepatitis B antigens found on the surface of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Serological Hematology Hepatitis B Surface Antigen Test Collection Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the serological hematology test, the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens, for the hepatitis B surface antigen, any one of the hepatitis B antigens found on the surface of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.:Hematology; the branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the in vitro reactions and properties of immune sera, particularly, the concept refers to the use of such reactions to measure serum titers of antibody against infectious and non-infectious agents (serologic tests), to the clinical correlations of the antibody titer, and to the use of serologic reactions to detect antigens.
The branch of medicine that deals with the blood and blood-forming organs and the diseases thereof.

Property.preferredName: Hepatitis B Virus HBsAg Surface Protein Antigen Collection Status Laboratory Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: Any one of the hepatitis B antigens found on the surface of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles. Several subspecificities of the surface antigen are known. These were formerly called the Australia antigen.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:A condition or state at a particular time.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.longName: Hepatitis B Virus HBsAg Surface Protein Antigen
Concepts.definition: Any one of the hepatitis B antigens found on the surface of the Dane particle and on the 20 nm spherical and tubular particles. Several subspecificities of the surface antigen are known. These were formerly called the Australia antigen.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
A condition or state at a particular time.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
